title: Doc Hammer
text:
Eric Hammer (born February 2, 1967), known professionally as Doc Hammer, is an American voice actor, musician, writer and artist. He performed in the <a href="gothic%20rock">gothic rock</a> bands Requiem in White from 1985 to 1995 and <a href="Mors%20Syphilitica">Mors Syphilitica</a> from 1995 to 2002, both with his then-wife <a href="Lisa%20Hammer">Lisa Hammer</a>. His film credits include a number of Lisa's projects—released through their own production company Blessed Elysium—in which he participated as a writer, actor, composer, designer, and visual effects artist. He also composed the music for the 1997 film "<a href="A%2C%20B%2C%20C...%20Manhattan">A, B, C... Manhattan</a>". He and <a href="Christopher%20McCulloch">Christopher McCulloch</a> are the co-creators, writers, and editors of the animated television series "<a href="The%20Venture%20Bros.">The Venture Bros.</a>" (2004–2020), in which Hammer voices several recurring characters including Billy Quizboy, Henchman 21, Dr. Mrs. The Monarch, and Dermott Fictel. The show is produced through Hammer and McCulloch's company Astro-Base Go. Hammer is also the guitarist and lead vocalist of the band <a href="Weep%20%28band%29">Weep</a>, which formed in 2008. In 2021 Hammer founded the band Pageant Girls with vocalist Ivy Jaff.
Early life.
Hammer was born in <a href="Ledyard%2C%20Connecticut">Ledyard, Connecticut</a>. He has stated that his hair naturally grows in both black and blonde, a condition he attributes to "a pigmentation problem or a birthmark or something. But my hair is naturally like this... Kinda. Because my eyebrows are black, I used to dye my whole head that color. Also, I used to enjoy looking like Dracula for some asinine reason." He lives with <a href="M%C3%A9ni%C3%A8re%27s%20disease">Ménière's disease</a>, a disorder of the <a href="inner%20ear">inner ear</a> that can affect <a href="hearing%20%28sense%29">hearing</a> and <a href="balance%20%28ability%29">balance</a>. He is a self-taught oil painter.
Personal life.
He adopted the pseudonym "Doc" in the mid-2000s.
In July 2018, Dark Horse Books, a division of <a href="Dark%20Horse%20Comics">Dark Horse Comics</a>, published "<a href="https%3A//www.amazon.com/Go-Team-Venture-Making-Bros/dp/1506704875/ref%3Dsr_1_1%3Fie%3DUTF8%26amp%3Bqid%3D1541558287%26amp%3Bsr%3D8-1%26amp%3Bkeywords%3Dthe%2Bventure%2Bbros%2Bbook">Go Team Venture! The Art And Making Of The Venture Bros</a>". The book, co-authored by Hammer, Christopher McCulloch, and <a href="Kenneth%20Plume">Kenneth Plume</a> details the entire history of the creation of "The Venture Bros." episode by episode from seasons one through six.
